description: Borrowed from Latin extinguo (“to put out (what is burning), quench, extinguish, deprive of life, destroy, abolish”), from ex (“out”) + stinguere (“to put out, quench, extinguish”).

verbs.description: extinguish (third-person singular simple present extinguishes, present participle extinguishing, simple past and past participle extinguished)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To put out, as in fire; to end burning; to quench.

examples: They intended to extinguish the enemy by force of numbers
The rays of the sun were extinguished by the thunder clouds.
A beauty that extinguishes all others by comparison

entries.meaning: (transitive, psychology) To bring about the extinction of a conditioned reflex.
examples: Many patients can extinguish their phobias after a few months of treatment.

entries.meaning: (transitive, literally) To hunt down (a species) to extinction.
